data.title: Lovely place!!
data.text: As traveling from England, liverpool. The manager is fabulously attentive. Lovely group of staff. Wide selection of tequila, love atmosphere will attend again when back in Ventura or Camarillo

data.title: Great local place for Mexican food
data.text: Located in Old Town Camarillo, El Rey is a fun place for a group with great tacos and as I understand - great margaritas (I don't drink).  This is a fixture in Camarillo - there is a charge for chips and salsa, which seemed to be an issue for some patrons.

data.title: Their tacos used to be good
data.text: I used to love their tacos, but for some reason the quality has gone way down. I wish restaurant owners would raise prices instead of lowering quality to save money. Once you lose a customer, it's hard to get them back.

data.title: Nothing fancy, but good food and good service
data.text: It is always fun to go to El Rey. The food is pretty good and reasonably priced. The staff has always been attentive and friendly. A good casual place for a meal.

data.title: Best time!
data.text: Went here with a friend and the service was awesome! The waitress was attentive and happy. I felt comfortable and welcomed. The food was great. I recommend this place for a good drink and delicious bite to eat. Great time for friends.

data.title: good food and service
data.text: El Rey Cantina, has great atmosphere, friendly staff, quality food, good salas bar, great 99-cent tacos

data.title: This place used to be good but now it is a bar with bar food
data.text: We used to go here all the time but things have changed. You actually have to pay for chips and salsa! The food is average. This is a place to go have drinks and cheap food specials. Taco Tuesdays and happy hour have prevailed at this "restaurant". If you want to hang out with friends for drinks and a cheap night this is the place. If you are coming for dinner, forget it. They are obviously catering to the eat cheap and party crowd. Which has it's place. But we won't be going there anymore.

data.title: No words
data.text: Awful food. I've been a Cam local for 35 years. Not sure what'd going on in this place. Dingy, worn out, creepy.

data.title: Fun, laid-back...great tacos!
data.text: We love this place to grab a taco and a PBR. It very much a bar scene in my opinion. They only have 805 on draft and some beers in cans and bottles. Great service.  One thing to always look out for is the 18% gratuity that they will tac onto your bill without notifying you for a party of 6 or more. In our experience, the waitress counted our infant and 2 young children in order to get to a party of 6. We were there for chips and salsa bar and the kids did not eat. Otherwise, good experience!

data.title: Good food, good value
data.text: We really enjoyed a late dinner at El Rey last week. We shared a plate of nachos--nest restaurant nachos I've ever had--and various tacos (al pastor, barbacoa and gringo). All were very good. The service as fast and attentive.

data.title: Great evening out.
data.text: A great place to hang out and watch the games!  Good selection of beer and cocktail with yummy appetizers.

data.title: Very enjoyable establisment!
data.text: Frank the bartender is excellent!!  It was really nice to watch sports and meet some friendly people.  Youll see all different types of  patrons here.  Older and younger people relaxing and talking,  it just meshes well with the atmosphere in the Cantina.

data.title: Happy hour tacos rock!!!
data.text: Ya know.....the world economy isn't great.....and sometimes offering a BARGAIN attracts customers!!! El Rey sure did....as their happy hour menu rocks!!!

data.title: Tiny Tactos
data.text: I ordered classic tacos on Taco Tuesday. I have a choice of meats. Basic taco was $1.00.  Cheese was extra. These were tiny tacos, about 2-3 bite size.  Service was quick. They were willing to do separate checks. I don't like to rate a restaurant as poor. I felt this was below average.    Would I return?  Probably not.

data.title: Don't waste your time, there is better down the street...
data.text:
Ordered take-out tacos...not too tough I thought, WRONG!
Place had two booths full on a Sunday night and a young guy behind the bar and a young gal working the floor. I waited literally 10 minutes while these two talked to be able to order....then, I waited 20 minutes for tacos with no one else in the restaurant. TV blaring, dark, dirty atmosphere. The final straw was when the young man brought out the food he forgot the bill and left my food on the bar in a bag and disappeared in back to get the bill. After 10 minutes I walked in back, past the kitchen where workers were cleaning and no one around. This is when I should have left, but we were hungry and tired after work. Finally, the guy returns with the bill and I paid and said, you know anybody could have just left with or without the food and you wouldn't have noticed...he just said, oh well, you waited! NEVER AGAIN! Rude, cold food, limited bar menu at best, dark and dirty. One block down the street is a Mexican market with a take-out counter and a full store that rocks! The market is called Establos Meat Market! Across the street from the market is another Mexican take-out restaurant that is great too....go to these two instead!

data.title: Not so Much :(
data.text: There were 4 of us from work attempting to enjoy a meal.  The food had very little flavor.  Just a disappointment.

data.title: Outdoor tables
data.text: Today was my second lunch visit and it was perfectly timed so we could eat at the outdoor tables and watch the steady stream of fully costumed trick or treaters hitting the businesses along the street on a sunny Saturday afternoon. Our server was fun and conscientious and brought us extra habanero sauce to go with a flavorful fish taco and my huge fresh tostada salad full of pumpkin seeds and other nice flavors. The cobb salad was chock full of bacon and a grilled chicken breast. The chips were light and crisp, and the iced tea was huge. Lots of mixed drinks available as well

data.title: Taco Tuesday
data.text: Dollar tacos, $3 beer.  Free chips and mediocre service.  I am not sure why I keep coming back here.  Food is ok.  It's loud most of the time.  Nice velvet Elvis collection.

data.title: OK
data.text: Came here for Taco Tuesday with my bf. Their outdoor dog friendly patio was nice. The tacos were just ok. The adobada was the only taco but everything else was just disappointing. Taco Tuesday may be worth it if you're coming here just for the adobada. However, it was still pretty packed when we came here so they must be doing something right because a lot of people were that night.

data.title: Not on Fight Night
data.text: Went for dinner on a Friday evening but young crowd watching fight club, a bit loud for us but dinner was pretty good.  Waiteress seemed overwhelmed so we had to be a bit patient but, our food came in a timely manner and was hot.
